title: LL gets a job!
content:
We-e-ell, the whole 'destroy the Keen community' thing just doesn't pay that well, and, neediing to buy more equipment I am forced to labour under the hot sun.

Quite literally as it happens, I am working at one of NZ's major producers of Kamau kamau; a green squat kind of zuccini-squash cross. Currently I am the only picker, so if you're in NZ and eat one, ther is a 1 in 3 chance I touched it! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sick.gif[/img]

They also export. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img]

It is hot work and I have to bike 10Km there and back each day, but it pays $10 an hour so I'm not arguing. [Even with you Glo.]

What was your first job, and what do you think of work?


A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Oh wow
content:
HTML Comments are not allowed.

Edit: What?! When did I use HTML? Grumble. Now I gotta construct the whole post from memory.

Congrats on a new job, LL! Glad to hear you're making money. I believe in the US, you need to be at least 16 to get a job, though many companies in my area won't hire a person unless they're 18. All the under 18's have to work for fast food or grocery stores. Yuck!

My first job was at the community college I attended, monitoring a computer music laboratory--it was a rediculously easy job. Basically I got paid minimum wage ($6.75/hour in California) to browse the internet and make sure everyone knew how to use File--Save As and File--Open on their machines. :-D Cake!

Currently I'm working for a racquetball company, doing data entry and some phone work regarding their sponsored player program. It's similarly easy, though there are a few more guidelines which didn't exist with the college--of course, the pay is much better, as well (nearly double my previous hourly rate!)

I hope your new job serves you well--and I'm sure any future boyfriends will be thankful you ride your bike so far each day. I should do something like that; I've put on a couple pounds since high school. But in order to do that, I'd need more free time--and that's just not working out for me *glances at dusty XkyKeen4 folder* :-(

title: Re: Oh wow
content:
Hmm... my first job.

I don't really have a regular job. My parents pay me to work for them, because they can save hundreds of $$$.

I think my first job, then, would be cleaning my room.[hr]

title: Re: LL gets a job!
content:
My first job was at a farm, I was so good that they sent me home once and would phone me later, I'm still waiting for that call.

Anyway vegetables are the greatest thing on earth especially when rotten. So I decided to make some career in it and so it comes that today I'm the head of all green-grocers in a local supermarket.
[img]http://members.lycos.nl/holydjaser/DSC00621.JPG[/img]
And even though it doesn't pay as well as LL job, I'm still very proud with what I have accomplished.
Thank you for your attention.

My first job was in a lab. I had to wash cylinders and such, enter data into computers, and I got paid a lousy $6.00. Oh well...~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

title: Re: LL gets a job!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]It is hot work and I have to bike 10Km there and back each day, but it pays $10 an hour so I'm not arguing.[hr][/quote]
CRAP! A chick is making almost twice what I am getting! AND she gets more exercise going TO and DURING her job. I need to get a landscaping job again.

But pretzel time... is THE easiest job... I will EVER have. On Wednesday I got paid to make sculptures out of pretzel dough, while my co worker got paid to go shopping, yes SHOPPING in the mall. AND I get all the icecream, soda, and pretzels I want. (Too bad I am trying to stay away from junk food.) [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sick.gif[/img]

How awesome is that, huh?-----------------------
[img]http://i34.photobucket.com/albums/d134/Galaxieretter/shikadimastercopy.gif[/img]

title: Re: LL gets a job!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]My first job was in a lab. I had to wash cylinders and such, enter data into computers, and I got paid a lousy $6.00. Oh well...[hr][/quote]

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img]

I only make $3 for mowing both our front, and back yards!!! that takes about 1.5 hours!!!

[quote]Quote:[hr]I need to get a landscaping job again[hr][/quote]

My cousin used to shovel mulch into peoples beds, and would get $20 and hour, per person. He brought a friend, and so they could do a house in about a half an hour, and still make off with the $20 a peice!!!

And he's really tough now; I used to be able to match him in football, now he just picks me up by the coller, and throws me out of his way!!!

(It hurts the neck a bit, though)
